snippet: General Motors has outlined a pretty good plan to compensate people in cases involving a defective ignition switch, but hard work lies ahead in filing claims.
abstract: Editorial supports plan outlined by Kenneth Feinberg, lawyer who oversaw Sept 11, 2011, victims' fund, to compensate people for deaths and injuries caused by defective ignition switch that General Motors used in 2.6 million cars; says that while money cannot make up for deaths or serious injuries, GM should do all that it can to help those victims and any others seriously impacted by faulty parts.
lead_paragraph: General Motors has outlined a pretty good plan to compensate people in cases involving a defective ignition switch, but hard work lies ahead in filing claims.
